definitions.body: † [[כִּנּוֹר]] n.m. :Ps 81:3 lyre (on formation cf. Lag:BN 89, Anm.; NH id.; Aram. [[כִּנׇּרָא]], kenro0; Mand. ([[א]])[[כינאר]] Nö:M § 104 (who questions Shemitic origin); Ar. kina0run, kina0rah;un; as loan-word in Hellen. Gk. kinu/ra (LXX and Joseph.); in Egypt. kn-an-aul acc. to Bondi:79)—abs. ´[[כ]] Ge 4:21 +; sf. [[כִּנּׁרִי]] Job 30:31; pl. [[כִּנּׁרוֹת]] 1Ki 10:12 +; sf. [[כִּנּוֹרַיִח]] Ez Eze 26:13, [[כִּנּׁרוֹתֵינוּ]] Ps 137:2; —lyre, stringed instrument used for popular as well as sacred music (cf. Benz:Arch. 273 ff. Now:Arch. i. 273 ff.);—´[[יְעוּגׇבכ]] Ge 4:21, ´[[בְּתׂף וּבְכ]] Ge 31:27; ´[[אִישׁ יׁדֵעַ מְנַגֵּן בַּכּ]] 1Sa 16:16 a man skilled in playing on the lyre, cf. v:1Sa 16:23 (([[וִנִגֵּן בְּיׇדוֹ]]); at banquets Is 5:12 (+ [[נֶבֶל]], [[תּׂף]], [[חָלִיל]]), token of merriment Is 24:8 (+ [[תֻּפִּים]]), Ez Eze 26:13, cf. [[וַיְהִי לְאֵבֶל כִּנּׁרִָי וְעֻגׇבִי לְקוֹל בּׂכִים]] Job 30:31, [[וְיִשְׂמְחוּ לְקוֹל עוּגׇב]] ´[[יִשְׂאוּ כְתׂף וְכ]] Job 21:12; carried by a loose woman Is 23:16 (fig. of Tyre); in sim. Is 16:11 (of murmuring sound of bowels = heart, in pity); used also in praising ´[[י]], usu. As accompaniment of song (cf. 1Ch 15:16) ´[[נֵבֶל וְתׂף וְחָלִיל וְכ]] 1Sa 10:5; Is 30:32 (‖[[תֻּפִּים]]); esp. before the ark 2Sa 6:5 (+ [[נְבָלִים]], [[תֻּפִּים]], etc.) ‖ 1Ch 13:8, and in sanctuary (usu. + [[נֵבֶל]], etc.) 1Ki 10:12, but esp. Chr Psalm Psalm:—1Ch 13:8 (pl., and so chiefly in Chr), 1Ch 15:16, 1Ch 15:21, 1Ch 15:28, 1Ch 16:5, 1Ch 25:1, 1Ch 25:3, 1Ch 25:6, 2Ch 5:12, 2Ch 9:11, 2Ch 20:28, 2Ch 29:25, Ne 12:27, Ps 33:2 (sg., and so chiefly in Psalm Psalm), Ps 43:4, Ps 49:5, Ps 57:9, Ps 71:22, Ps 81:3, Ps 92:4, Ps 98:5, Ps 98:5, Ps 108:3, Ps 147:7, Ps 149:3, Ps 150:3; cf. [[כִּנּׁרוֹתֵינוּ]] Ps 137:2.—Vbs. used with ´[[כ]] are:—[[תָּפַשׂ]] Ge 4:21, [[נִגֵּן בְּ]] 1Sa 16:16, [[מְשַׂחֵק בְּ]] 2Sa 6:5 = 1Ch 13:8, [[מְשׁׂרֲרִים בּ]] 1Ch 15:16, [[מַשְׁמִיעִים בְּ]] v:1Ch 15:28, [[נִבָּא בְּ]] 1Ch 25:1, 1Ch 25:3, [[הוֹדָה בְּ]] Ps 33:2, Ps 43:4, [[זמּר בְּ]] Ps 71:22, Ps 98:5, Ps 147:7, Ps 149:3, [[הַלֲלוּהוּ בְּ]] Ps 150:3.—On ancient lyres v. reff. ap.
